Platform.getResourceBundle  is suppose to throw a MissingResourceException if 
the resource is not found.  The other posibility it that the varialbe plugin is 
null.  

Unfotunatly I no longer own the comptuer where the error occured so I can't 
reporduce it.

The plugin variable can't be null because it's set to point to "this" in the
constructor.  So only bad behavior of the platform/configuration can account for
this.

IMHO a NPE is always an error.  
Since Platform.getResourceBundle()  claims to throw a MissingResourceException 
it seems to me that it is a bug that it ever returns null.  =

Yes, Platform.getResourceBundle returning null, which is the only way to account
for the behavior you are seeing, would seem bad.  But then, it doesn't normally
do this with a good configuration/installation, so having the platform folks fix
this will require them being able to reproduce the problem. And I can't
reproduce it, so they likely can't either. :-(

It might be worth a code walk through.  The javadocs effectly assert that it 
won;t return null.  Perhaps they can just spot the error,  if not they could 
test before return and throw a MissingResourceException so that we get a better 
error message.
